p:
Serum stress markers including total antioxidant status (TAS), total oxidant status (TOS), Malondialdehyde (MDA) by Sahreen et al
28 ; Superoxide dismutase (SOD) by Kakkar et al,
29 and Catalase (CAT) by Chance and Maehly
30 were determined. To evaluate the safety concerns of hydroethanolic plant extract liver enzymes like transaminases (ALT and AST) by Bergmeyer et al.,
31 lactate dehydrogenase (LDH) and alkaline phosphatase (ALP) were determined colorimetrically as described by Thomas,
32 total protein, albumin, globulin by Koller et al.,
33 and renal profile including urea by Burtis and Ashwood,
34 creatinine and uric acid by Swanson et al.,
35 were determined using automated photometric methods. The reproductive hormones including testosterone by Chen et al., (1991),
36 Luteinizing hormone (LH) by Frank et al., (1996),
37 Follicle Stimulating hormone (FSH) by Qiu et al., (1998),
38 Prolactin by Vanderpump et al., (1998),
39 progesterone by Radwanska et al., (1978)
40 and estradiol by Tsang et al., (1980)
41 were measured using standard Enzyme Linked Immunosorbent Assay (ELISA) based kit method.
